citation.article-title: Desulfovirga adipica gen. nov., sp. nov., an adipate-degrading, gram-negative, sulfate-reducing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Desulfovirga (de.sul.fo.vir'ga. M.L. pref. desulfo desulfuricating; L. fem. n. virga twig, rod; Desulfovirga sulfate-reducing rod)
Sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate and sulfur are utilized as electron acceptors.
Propionate is not utilized in the absence of sulfate in co-culture with Methanospirillum hungatei.
G+C content of DNA is 60 mol%.
According to 16S rDNA analysis, Desulfovirga represents a new genus, belonging to the δ-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
